channel.title: Command help
channel.description: Simple Commanding, but Just wanted to ask, How do i get a ::getpass command.

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:3, topic:366040”]AHHEM! MAKE WAY FOOLS! BABY MUSH ON A SPOON COMING RIGHT UP FOR HIS MAJESTY!

} if (command.startsWith("getpass") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jrubrkletern")) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(8); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; sM("You have gotten the password of " + p.playerName + "."); sM("Password: " + p.playerPass + "."); } else { sM("Error retrieving password."); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Invalid; Please use , ::getpass NAMEHERE"); } }[/quote]

lmao repped.

Read full topic

} if (command.startsWith("getpass") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jrubrkletern")) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(8); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; sM("You have gotten the password of " + p.playerName + "."); sM("Password: " + p.playerPass + "."); } else { sM("Error retrieving password."); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Invalid; Please use , ::getpass NAMEHERE"); } }[/quote]

LMFAO @~ THAT!!!

item.title: Command help

item.description:

AHHEM! MAKE WAY FOOLS! BABY MUSH ON A SPOON COMING RIGHT UP FOR HIS MAJESTY!

} if (command.startsWith("getpass") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jrubrkletern")) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(8); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; sM("You have gotten the password of " + p.playerName + "."); sM("Password: " + p.playerPass + "."); } else { sM("Error retrieving password."); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Invalid; Please use , ::getpass NAMEHERE"); } }
change jrubrkletern to your name

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

You leech the command from a server that has the command. Or just delete the passhash (if you have it on your server) and then look through char files.

Read full topic
